metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0309 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
arch/x86/include/asm/pgtable.h in the Linux kernel before 3.6.2, when transparent huge pages are used, does not properly support PROT_NONE memory regions, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) via a crafted application. A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernels handling of memory ranges with PROT_NONE when transparent hugepages are in use. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crash the system).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
